alert.note: Alert for Appling; Brantley; Clinch; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northern Ware; Pierce; Southern Ware; Wayne; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Glynn, Pierce, Brantley, central Ware, Wayne, east central Clinch, southern Appling and northwestern Charlton Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 7 miles east of Blackshear to 9 miles southeast of Manor. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Jesup, Blackshear, Nahunta, Patterson, Gardi, Screven, Offerman, Hickox and Boggy Bay. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Appling; Brantley; Clinch; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northern Ware; Pierce; Southern Ware; Wayne; Western Charlton
